intro: Aporrhiza letestui, commonly known as the Florida seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Zosteraceae. It is characterized by its ribbon-like leaves that are adapted for life in shallow coastal waters. This species plays a crucial role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms. It typically grows in dense meadows that form important ecosystems in tropical and subtropical regions. Aporrhiza letestui is also known for its ability to tolerate fluctuating salinity levels and is an indicator species for healthy coastal environments.
